This cottage is an excellent place to stay and highly recommended. From the 1940’s build to the cute inset porch to all the wonderful amenities provided, we feel we found a gem in the woods and will be returning regularly for a relaxing friends getaway. We were fairly confused by the previous review as we had a lovely time and did not experience that in the least bit. But some people (or “Karen’s”) are just complainers no matter where they go.
As two women traveling, we felt totally safe and secure in the cottage. Everything was clean and tidy with plenty of extra blankets, towels and kitchen amenities. There are board games and books available as well as fishing rods and canoes. We took advantage of the fire pit and roasted hot dogs for dinner one evening. Our host was incredibly nice and brought us extra firewood for the pit. They made sure we had everything we needed for our stay. There is also a remote control fire in the fireplace, so looking forward to returning in the winter time. There are plenty of cool things to do in Greenville nearby. If you don’t go to Beanz Buttercream Bakery and get a raspberry sweet roll, you’ll regret it the rest of you life. Very much enjoyed finding the surfboard! We instantly became detectives. Good luck to the next visitor! You have two clues to decipher.
We will totally be back.
